sample_capture.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 """
2 A helper python script to take and save sample pictures of markers that can be used to test on other
3 detection algorithms
4 """
5 
6 
7 import pyrealsense2 as rs
8 import numpy as np
9 import cv2
10 
11 # Create a pipeline
12 pipeline = rs.pipeline()
13 
14 # Create a config and configure the pipeline to stream
15 # different resolutions of color and depth streams
16 config = rs.config()
17 
18 # Get device product line for setting a supporting resolution
19 pipeline_wrapper = rs.pipeline_wrapper(pipeline)
20 pipeline_profile = config.resolve(pipeline_wrapper)
21 device = pipeline_profile.get_device()
22 device_product_line = str(device.get_info(rs.camera_info.product_line))
23 
24 
25 config.enable_stream(rs.stream.depth, 640, 480, rs.format.z16, 30)
26 config.enable_stream(rs.stream.color, 640, 480, rs.format.bgr8, 30)
27 
28 # Start streaming
29 profile = pipeline.start(config)
30 
31 
32 # Create an align object
33 # rs.align allows us to perform alignment of depth frames to others frames
34 # The "align_to" is the stream type to which we plan to align depth frames.
35 align_to = rs.stream.color
36 align = rs.align(align_to)
37 
38 # Streaming loop
39 try:
40  while True:
41  # Get frameset of color and depth
42  frames = pipeline.wait_for_frames()
43  # frames.get_depth_frame() is a 640x360 depth image
44 
45  # Align the depth frame to color frame
46  aligned_frames = align.process(frames)
47 
48  # Get aligned frames
49  aligned_depth_frame = aligned_frames.get_depth_frame() # aligned_depth_frame is a 640x480 depth image
50  color_frame = aligned_frames.get_color_frame()
51 
52 
53  # depth_image = np.asanyarray(aligned_depth_frame.get_data())
54  color_image = np.asanyarray(color_frame.get_data())
55 
56  cv2.namedWindow('RGB Images', cv2.WINDOW_NORMAL)
57  cv2.imshow('RGB Images', color_image)
58  key = cv2.waitKey(1)
59  # Press esc or 'q' to close the image window
60  if key & 0xFF == ord('q') or key == 27:
61  cv2.destroyAllWindows()
62  break
63  # Press 'a' to capture an image
64  elif key & 0xFF == ord('a'):
65  cv2.imwrite('image1.png',color_image)
66 finally:
67  pipeline.stop()
